title: SESAME - Sesame SEmantic SmArt Metering: Enablers for Energy Efficiency

author: Anna Fensel, FTW Forschungszentrum Telekommunikation Wien GmbH

segmentation: So my presentation will be about SESAME which stands for semantic smart metering and enables for energy efficiency.
It is a project in fact, which has just finished in.
November and it was done by the W Telecommunications Research Center, Vienna, and four more companies.
From Austria from Serbia.
And from Russia.
So this is the outline for my presentation, so I will give motivation what we did, what we wanted to achieve and what we have done at the end.
Um?
Showing from hardware to software.
So first of all, we all know that climate change is a very big issue for politicians.
For SoC for OS which gets warmer all the time and there are different regulations that there should be a 20% of savings by 2020 and there will be introduction of smart meters.
So instead of the old meters you have in your house, there will be smart meters which measure information about your energy consumption every.
15 minutes and there is more awareness of what's going on in the energy grid and so energy efficiency is obviously a very hot area.
Yeah nowadays.
So to address this high level problem, we have designed the project which was named sesamin.
So for people coming from semantic communities, just notice that it's not OK.

It's not an RDF repository and it's not to see it has nothing to do with biology, and it's also not a Sesame Street show, even though consulting sometimes look like this project goal is to facilitate basically people, homeowners and building managers and end consumers to make.
Conscious decisions about their energy consumption practices, and.
Use appliances at home which.
Basically safe energy and also keep their preferred quality of living.
Of the person now.

So we used smart meter technology and we basically collected data from this kind of Internet of Things set up in the home and use this data for.
End user services.

We're dealing only with end users and service provider.

All in their life standards.

Op, to optimize the trading of electricity on the grid to make decisions which.
Electricity to put in which pieces of the grid.

Data.

Server.

We also did something like trying to learn more about users and green.

For example about reputations, but cost savings are quite essentially.

Can buy yet as a product and.

Bring all this value.
For different stakeholders with the users applications and with all the data which collected model semantically, it can be reused across domains.

Then I would thank you for attention and once again invite to visit the booth and get more information or even give us more feedback by filling out a survey which is lying over there.
And that was it.
